DataElement.preferredName: Ancillary Study KIT Gene Mutation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate the type of molecular genetic abnormality associated with the mutation of the c-kit (CD117) proto-oncogene in the development of gastrointestinal stromal tumor as part of secondary study data.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A study that is secondary to another study._A molecular genetic abnormality that refers to mutation of the c-kit (CD117) proto-oncogene. It is associated with the development of gastrointestinal stromal tumor and gastrointestinal autonomic nerve tumor. It has also been described in acute myeloid leukemias, dysgerminomas, and seminomas.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A study that is secondary to another study.

Concepts.definition: A study that is secondary to another study.

Property.preferredDefinition: A molecular genetic abnormality that refers to mutation of the c-kit (CD117) proto-oncogene. It is associated with the development of gastrointestinal stromal tumor and gastrointestinal autonomic nerve tumor. It has also been described in acute myeloid leukemias, dysgerminomas, and seminomas.

Concepts.definition: A molecular genetic abnormality that refers to mutation of the c-kit (CD117) proto-oncogene. It is associated with the development of gastrointestinal stromal tumor and gastrointestinal autonomic nerve tumor. It has also been described in acute myeloid leukemias, dysgerminomas, and seminomas.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A molecular genetic abnormality that refers to mutation of the c-kit (CD117) proto-oncogene. It is associated with the development of gastrointestinal stromal tumor and gastrointestinal autonomic nerve tumor. It has also been described in acute myeloid leukemias, dysgerminomas, and seminomas._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question to determine if a KIT mutation that is not listed on the form was found in the study.

Concepts.definition: A question to determine if a KIT mutation that is not listed on the form was found in the study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1669 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where thymine has been mutated to adenine.

Concepts.definition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1669 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where thymine has been mutated to adenine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1676 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where thymine has been mutated to cytosine.

Concepts.definition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1676 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where thymine has been mutated to cytosine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1924 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where adenine has been mutated to guanine.

Concepts.definition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1924 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where adenine has been mutated to guanine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1727 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where thymine has been mutated to cytosine.

Concepts.definition: A nucleotide substitution at position 1727 of the coding sequence of the KIT gene where thymine has been mutated to cytosine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetic finding indicating that KIT gene mutations have not been detected in a sample.

Concepts.definition: A genetic finding indicating that KIT gene mutations have not been detected in a sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
